0.title: ATX Game Designers
0.photoAlt: Photo of ATX Game Designers website
0.blurb: Created for local board game design group ATX Game Designers as part of my Web Development Practicum (final coursework). There are 2 versions of this site: 1 in WordPress for the client, and 1 in vanilla HTML, CSS, and JS for the college.

1.title: In the Dark Timer
1.photoAlt: Photo of In The Dark Timer website
1.blurb: In the Dark Timer is a companion web app for a board game. The game's Designer required a timer with vague effects that would indicate time was passing without revealing the actual time remaining. Built to accept data via a custom PHP backend.

2.title: Tiny Photography Gallery
2.photoAlt: Photo of Tiny Photo Gallery project
2.blurb: Portfolio project and exploration of the Bootstrap CSS framework. Photography sourced from Allec Gomes, Ivan Rudoy, Kevin Mueller, and Kyle Nieber via Unsplash.

0.title: Fight for Phoenix
0.photoAlt: Title image for Fight for Phoenix
0.blurb: Fight for Phoenix is a prototype produced for the in-person ATX Game Makers 2nd Annual Game Jam-A-Thon. I assisted as a Unity Programmer by designing the movement and feel of the Player and Enemy entities.

1.title: Redneck Fishin
1.photoAlt: Title protagonist Curtis without a shirt.
1.blurb: Submission for Global Game Jam 2024. I assisted a team relatively new to game jams as a Godot Programmer and Support Designer. Hosted by the Museum of Human Achievement in Austin.

2.title: Dagger Duel
2.photoAlt: Photo from the page I setup to show Dagger Duel to potential publishers.
2.blurb: Dagger Duel web demo. Dagger Duel is a 2 player abstract boardgame I've been developing since March 2023. This project has undergone thousands of thematic and mechanical iterations, and I'm hoping to finish it before the end of 2024. I'm currently unsure how publishing will work.
